dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4709 IH: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to amend the Federal medical assistance percentage for the District of Columbia for fiscal years after 2019, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Griffith introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to amend the Federal medical assistance percentage for the District of Columbia for fiscal years after 2019, and for other purposes.

section.header: FMAP for District of Columbia for fiscal years after 2019
section.text: Section 1905 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking , and (aa) and inserting , (aa), and (ee); and
by inserting for each fiscal year before fiscal year 2020 after District of Columbia shall be 70 percent; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: FMAP for District of Columbia for fiscal years after 2019

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (b), beginning with fiscal year 2020, the Federal medical assistance percentage for the District of Columbia for a fiscal year shall be the higher of the Federal medical assistance percentage otherwise determined under subsection (b) for the District of Columbia for such fiscal year or the alternative Federal medical assistance percentage specified in paragraph (2) for such fiscal year.
The alternative Federal medical assistance percentage specified in this paragraph for—

subparagraph.text: fiscal year 2027 and each succeeding fiscal year is 54 percent.
